name: Worldly Tutor
text: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

editions.flavor:
"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, Tales

"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, Tales

name: Worldpurge
text: Return all permanents to their owners' hands. Each player chooses up to seven cards in his or her hand, then shuffles the rest into his or her library. Empty all mana pools.

editions.flavor: The Aurora is not the only magic capable of remaking a world.

name: World Queller
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a card type. If you do, each player sacrifices a permanent of that type.

editions.flavor:
"Why fight the world when you know who will win?"
—Nissa Revane

name: Worldslayer
text:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, destroy all permanents other than Worldslayer.
Equip {5} ({5}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor:
"If that is what you seek, try looking in craters."
—Fodrus, mastersmith

name: Worldspine Wurm
text:
Trample
When Worldspine Wurm dies, create three 5/5 green Wurm creature tokens with trample.
When Worldspine Wurm is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

name: Wormfang Behemoth
text:
When Wormfang Behemoth enters the battlefield, exile all cards from your hand.
When Wormfang Behemoth leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owner's hand.

name: Wormfang Crab
text:
Wormfang Crab can't be blocked.
When Wormfang Crab enters the battlefield, an opponent chooses a permanent you control other than Wormfang Crab and exiles it.
When Wormfang Crab leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

name: Wormfang Drake
text:
Flying
When Wormfang Drake enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile a creature you control other than Wormfang Drake.
When Wormfang Drake leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

name: Wormfang Manta
text:
Flying
When Wormfang Manta enters the battlefield, you skip your next turn.
When Wormfang Manta leaves the battlefield, you take an extra turn after this one.

name: Wormfang Newt
text:
When Wormfang Newt enters the battlefield, exile a land you control.
When Wormfang Newt leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

editions.flavor: Spawned by mages emulating the insane.

name: Wormfang Turtle
text:
When Wormfang Turtle enters the battlefield, exile a land you control.
When Wormfang Turtle leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

editions.flavor: Chainer's admirers keep his dreams alive.

name: Worm Harvest
text:
Create a 1/1 black and green Worm creature token for each land card in your graveyard.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

name: Worms of the Earth
text:
Players can't play lands.
Lands can't enter the battlefield.
At the beginning of each upkeep, any player may sacrifice two lands or have Worms of the Earth deal 5 damage to him or her. If a player does either, destroy Worms of the Earth.

editions.flavor: The ground collapsed, leaving nothing but the great Worms' mucous residues.

name: Wormwood Dryad
text:
{G}: Wormwood Dryad gains forestwalk until end of turn and deals 1 damage to you. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{B}: Wormwood Dryad gains swampwalk until end of turn and deals 1 damage to you. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

name: Wormwood Treefolk
text:
{G}{G}: Wormwood Treefolk gains forestwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{B}{B}: Wormwood Treefolk gains swampwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

name: Worn Powerstone
text:
Worn Powerstone enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space—vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal.
Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space—vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal.
Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space—vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor: Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space—vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal.

name: Worry Beads
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Worship
text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

editions.flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

name: Worst Fears
text: You control target player during that player's next turn. Exile Worst Fears. (You see all cards that player could see and make all decisions for the player.)

editions.flavor: Elspeth feared that her trespass into Nyx would not go unanswered.

name: Wort, Boggart Auntie
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target Goblin card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Auntie always knows which berries to lick, which kithkin to trick, and what to do when either goes wrong.

name: Worthy Cause
text:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
As an additional cost to cast Worthy Cause, sacrifice a creature.
You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

name: Wort, the Raidmother
text:
When Wort, the Raidmother enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 red and green Goblin Warrior creature tokens.
Each red or green instant or sorcery spell you cast has conspire. (As you cast the spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose new targets for the copy.)

name: Wound Reflection
text: At the beginning of each end step, each opponent loses life equal to the life he or she lost this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)

editions.flavor: The mission of the Nighthearth, Illulia's cult of murderous cinders, is to intensify every pain suffered in Shadowmoor.

name: Wrack with Madness
text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.

editions.flavor: The skathul, spirits consumed by revenge, fester and seethe while looking for weak minds to assault.

name: Wrangle
text: Gain control of target creature with power 4 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Gremlins are loyal to nothing but their next meal.

name: Wrap in Flames
text: Wrap in Flames deals 1 damage to each of up to three target creatures. Those creatures can't block this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Our pyromancer's flames may not have killed them, but they bought us the time we needed."
—The War Diaries

"Our pyromancer's flames may not have killed them, but they bought us the time we needed."
—The War Diaries

"Our pyromancer's flames may not have killed them, but they bought us the time we needed."
—The War Diaries

name: Wrap in Vigor
text: Regenerate each creature you control.

editions.flavor: Some nature mages unknowingly took advantage of the temporal energies still swirling on Dominaria. What they mistook for healing magic was in fact the manipulation of time.
Some nature mages unknowingly took advantage of the temporal energies still swirling on Dominaria. What they mistook for healing magic was in fact the manipulation of time.

name: Wrath of God
text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: Legend speaks of the lost coastal polis of Olantin, whose inhabitants' hubris enraged the sun god Heliod.

"As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods. They kill us for their sport."
—William Shakespeare, King Lear

name: Wrath of Marit Lage
text:
When Wrath of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all red creatures.
Red creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor:
"Marit Lage lies frozen in a glacier's heart. Still her dreams take form in our world, stealing the heat from our souls."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
Dread Marit Lage lies dreaming, not dead.

name: Wreak Havoc
text:
Wreak Havoc can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Destroy target artifact or land.

editions.flavor:
"Crush them!"
—Borborygmos

name: Wreath of Geists
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Before you travel the woods of Kessig, first get permission from those who died trying.

name: Wrecking Ball
text: Destroy target creature or land.

editions.flavor: Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.
Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.
Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.

name: Wrecking Ogre
text:
Double strike
Bloodrush — {3}{R}{R}, Discard Wrecking Ogre: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 and gains double strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: If no opponent can be found, ogres of the Bolrac Clan will often pick fights with buildings.

name: Wrench Mind
text: Target player discards two cards unless he or she discards an artifact card.

editions.flavor: What is the sound of one head snapping?

name: Wren's Run Packmaster
text:
Champion an Elf (When this creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elf you control. When this creature leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
{2}{G}: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
Wolves you control have deathtouch.

name: Wren's Run Vanquisher
text:
As an additional cost to cast Wren's Run Vanquisher, reveal an Elf card from your hand or pay {3}.
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins

name: Wretched Anurid
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life.

editions.flavor: The only prince inside this frog is the one it ate.

name: Wretched Banquet
text: Destroy target creature if it has the least power or is tied for least power among creatures on the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"The meek inherit nothing."
—Sedris, the Traitor King

name: Wretched Confluence
text:
Choose three. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Target player draws a card and loses 1 life.
• Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Wretched Gryff
text:
Emerge {5}{U} (You may cast this spell by sacrificing a creature and paying the emerge cost reduced by that creature's converted mana cost.)
When you cast Wretched Gryff, draw a card.
Flying

name: Wrexial, the Risen Deep
text:
Islandwalk, swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island or a Swamp.)
Whenever Wrexial, the Risen Deep deals combat damage to a player, you may cast target instant or sorcery card from that player's graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that card would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

name: Wring Flesh
text: Target creature gets -3/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"You shouldn't be so attached to something as fragile as flesh."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

"Don't blame me. You're the one walking around with skin."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Write into Being
text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Manifest one of those cards, then put the other on the top or bottom of your library. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

name: Writ of Passage
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, if its power is 2 or less, it can't be blocked this turn.
Forecast — {1}{U}, Reveal Writ of Passage from your hand: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

name: Wu Admiral
text: Wu Admiral gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.

editions.flavor: The Wu kingdom's well-trained admirals were integral to the Southlands' victory at Red Cliffs as well as the kingdom's defense.

name: Wu Elite Cavalry
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor: At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.
At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.
The first battle of Hefei was Sun Quan's last as a field general. From then on he let his generals command in the field while he directed battle from behind the front lines.

name: Wu Light Cavalry
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor: A cunning strategist, Cao Ren tricked Zhou Yu by letting him enter Nanjun. Zhou Yu thought he was capturing the city until Cao Ren's arrows rained down upon him.

name: Wu Longbowman
text: {T}: Wu Longbowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Wurmcalling
text:
Buyback {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Create an X/X green Wurm creature token.

name: Wurmcoil Engine
text:
Deathtouch, lifelink
When Wurmcoil Engine dies, create a 3/3 colorless Wurm artifact creature token with deathtouch and a 3/3 colorless Wurm artifact creature token with lifelink.

name: Wurmskin Forger
text: When Wurmskin Forger enters the battlefield, distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures.

editions.flavor: It takes three weeks for a patrol of hunters to down a slagwurm. It takes just as long to make a single cut in its hide.

name: Wurm's Tooth
text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.

"The great wurm bit down on me. Instead of being crunched bloody, I slid into the space where its tooth was missing. One tooth—a boon most potent, indeed."
—The Tall Tales of Oleander
A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
Jevna Nor lugged it around, bragging of his triumph over the wurm. Luckily, the tavern regulars didn't notice it was only a baby tooth.

name: Wurmweaver Coil
text:
Enchant green creature
Enchanted creature gets +6/+6.
{G}{G}{G}, Sacrifice Wurmweaver Coil: Create a 6/6 green Wurm creature token.

editions.flavor: Some use magic to spy through walls. Others use it to crush them.

name: Wu Scout
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
When Wu Scout enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.

name: Wu Spy
text: When Wu Spy enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of target player's library. Put one of them into his or her graveyard.

name: Wu Warship
text: Wu Warship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

editions.flavor: Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.
Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.

name: Wydwen, the Biting Gale
text:
Flash
Flying
{U}{B}, Pay 1 life: Return Wydwen, the Biting Gale to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: In a world of bright, cloudless skies, she is the dark storm on the horizon.

name: Wyluli Wolf
text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

name: Xantcha
text: Sacrifice a permanent: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor: A Phyrexian "sleeper agent," Xantcha has developed an inviolate sense of self. This aberration earned her a death sentence, but she was rescued by Urza and joined his crusade. Her Phyrexian credo of "Waste not, want not" has helped Urza more than even he comprehends.

name: Xanthic Statue
text: {5}: Until end of turn, Xanthic Statue becomes an 8/8 Golem artifact creature with trample.

editions.flavor:
"Until you have lived as a statue, do not talk to me of pigeons."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Xantid Swarm
text:
Flying
Whenever Xantid Swarm attacks, defending player can't cast spells this turn.

editions.flavor: When they land on you, all you can think about is tearing them off.
When they land on you, all you can think about is tearing them off.

name: Xathrid Demon
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Xathrid Demon, then each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power. If you can't sacrifice a creature, tap Xathrid Demon and you lose 7 life.

name: Xathrid Gorgon
text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
{2}{B}, {T}: Put a petrification counter on target creature. It gains defender and becomes a colorless artifact in addition to its other types. Its activated abilities can't be activated. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

name: Xathrid Necromancer
text: Whenever Xathrid Necromancer or another Human creature you control dies, create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: "My commands shall echo forever in their dusty skulls."
"My commands shall echo forever in their dusty skulls."

name: Xathrid Slyblade
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{3}{B}: Until end of turn, Xathrid Slyblade loses hexproof and gains first strike and deathtouch. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: Designed by Rob Pardo

name: Xenagos, God of Revels
text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to red and green is less than seven, Xenagos isn't a creature.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, another target creature you control gains haste and gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that creature's power.

name: Xenagos, the Reveler
text:
+1: Add X mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G} to your mana pool, where X is the number of creatures you control.
0: Create a 2/2 red and green Satyr creature token with haste.
−6: Exile the top seven cards of your library. You may put any number of creature and/or land cards from among them onto the battlefield.

name: Xenic Poltergeist
text: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

name: Xenograft
text:
As Xenograft enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Each creature you control is the chosen type in addition to its other types.

editions.flavor:
"I despise Vorinclex and his slobberings about ‘evolution.' Only I know true progress."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Sacrifice Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed: Return target black card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Xira Arien
text:
Flying
{B}{R}{G}, {T}: Target player draws a card.

editions.flavor: A regular guest at the Royal Masquerade, Arien is the envy of the Court. She appears in a new costume every hour.

text: {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor: "A splendid talent, admired of all men! His folly lay in serving Cao Cao's power."

text:
All creatures get -3/-3 until end of turn.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "The Consulate pushed me to my limit, darling, and this is the result."

text:
Haste
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Yahenni, Undying Partisan.
Sacrifice another creature: Yahenni gains indestructible until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "The time for subtlety is over, darling."

name: Yamabushi's Storm
text: Yamabushi's Storm deals 1 damage to each creature. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

name: Yare
text: Target creature defending player controls gets +3/+0 until end of turn. That creature can block up to two additional creatures this turn.

Trample

Pay 1 life: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: He craves only one commodity.
He craves only one commodity.

name: Yawgmoth's Edict
text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: The warping of bodies and souls has become the heart of Yawgmoth's existence.

"Phyrexia's purity permits no other."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

name: Yawgmoth's Will
text:
Until end of turn, you may play cards from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

name: Yawning Fissure
text: Each opponent sacrifices a land.

editions.flavor: The mapmaker scowled. He sighed, unrolled his parchment, and painted a large black blob where the Eternal Meadow was once marked.

name: Ydwen Efreet
text: Whenever Ydwen Efreet blocks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Ydwen Efreet from combat and it can't block this turn. Creatures it was blocking that had become blocked by only Ydwen Efreet this combat become unblocked.
